FacilityName: M&L Commodities dba Lineage Logistics - Stockton

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source 



Lineage Logistics has a long-standing commitment to worker, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the ammonia refrigeration system.  It is Lineage Logistics policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.  

The Program 3 at Lineage Logistics - Port of Stockton, is a facility run program with continuous support from Lineage Logistics - Compliance Department that includes; Process Safety Management (PSM) Compliance and Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Compliance.   





Stationary Source and Regulated Substance Handled



Lineage Logistics - Port of Stockton is located at 2323 Port Road A, Stockton. California. The area immediately surrounding the facility is mostly urban with some industrial and residential areas.

The regulated substance handled at the facility is anhydrous ammonia.  The facility's primary activities revolve around large-scale public storage of food products.  All of the ammonia inventory is used as refrigerant.





General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



As part of the implementation of the RMP Program, key Prevention Program elements were documented and implemented by Lineage Logistics - Port of Stockton, which also serve to manage process safety issues associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia.  Furthermore, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are currently utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed.  In reviewing the regulated substance at the facility, the covered process is the ammonia refrigeration system.  The regulated substance is over 10,000-lbs. federal threshold for the EPA -RMProgram and over the 500-lbs. state threshold for the CalARP Progr

am.   As a result, the anhydrous ammonia covered process is subject to EPA RMP Program 3.

Program 3 Prevention Program Elements include:

?    Process Safety Information

?    Process Hazard Analysis

?    Operating Procedures

?    Training

?    Mechanical Integrity

?    Management of Change

?    Pre- Start Safety Review

?    Compliance Audits

?    Incident Investigation

?    Employee Participation

?    Hot Work Permit

?    Contractors





Five-Year Accident History



For any accidental release meeting the five-year accident history reporting criteria of CFR 40 ?68.42(a) and 19 CCR ?2745.5, the owner or operator shall submit as part of the RMP the information required by Section ?68.42(b) on each accident covered by section ?68.42(a):



"The owner or operator shall include in the five-year accident history all accidental releases from covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage."

Lineage Logistics - Port of Stockton had no releases in the last five years (August 2013 - August 2018) that meets the five-year accident history reporting criteria, therefore no data is required. 





Emergency Response Program



Lineage Logistics - Port of Stockton has an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) in place to properly prepare for emergency evacuations, to provide first aid and medical treatment and to contact federal, state and local officials in the event of a major release of ammonia. The Facility Emergency Response Plan is coordinated with the local responding units, such as the local fire department or HAZMAT Team.   Furthermore, the Facility has submitted a Hazardous Material Inventory (HMI) Business Plan via California Environmental Reporting System (CERS).  

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Several studies have been conducted to examine mitigation measures to improve safety at the facility.  These studies include:

?A Hazard Assessment, whi

ch performed in June 2018

?A Process Hazard Analysis, which was performed in June 2018

?A Compliance audit, which was performed in January 2018

Any outstanding recommendations from these studies and the target completion date or closure have been provided within each individual report.
